MTR Route to Shenzhen via Lok Ma Chau | Generated by AI

Home 2025.10

You’re currently on the MTR at 5:51 AM on Sunday, October 12, 2025, and heading from Yau Ma Tei to Shenzhen via Lok Ma Chau - Huanggang. You mentioned Tsuen Wan, but you do not need to go to Tsuen Wan to reach Lok Ma Chau. Instead, you should head to Admiralty to transfer to the East Rail Line for Lok Ma Chau. Here’s what to do:

  1. From Yau Ma Tei to Admiralty (5-7 min):
    • You’re likely on the Tsuen Wan Line at Yau Ma Tei Station. Take the Tsuen Wan Line southbound toward Admiralty (3 stops: Jordan, Tsim Sha Tsui, Admiralty). This takes about 5-7 minutes.
    • Do not go toward Tsuen Wan (which is north/west and the opposite direction).
  2. Transfer at Admiralty to East Rail Line (5 min transfer):
    • At Admiralty, follow signs for the East Rail Line (northbound toward Lok Ma Chau). The first train to Lok Ma Chau departs around 6:00-6:15 AM on Sundays, so you’re just in time.
    • The ride to Lok Ma Chau Station takes ~40 minutes.
  3. From Lok Ma Chau Station to Border (5-10 min walk):
    • Exit the station and follow signs to the Lok Ma Chau Control Point (right next to the station).
  4. Cross Border via Shuttle Bus (15-30 min, HKD 10):
    • Clear Hong Kong immigration (10-20 min, use e-channels if eligible).
    • Take the 24-hour Huanggang - Lok Ma Chau Shuttle Bus (yellow bus, every 10-20 min overnight, cash/Octopus) to Huanggang Port in Shenzhen.
  5. Shenzhen Side:
    • Clear Shenzhen immigration (10-20 min, have passport/visa ready).
    • From Huanggang, take Shenzhen Metro Line 7 (~HKD 5-10, 20-30 min to Futian/Luohu) or a taxi/Didi (~HKD 30-50, 15-30 min).

Total Time from Now: ~1.5-2 hours to Shenzhen (including immigration).

Quick Check:

  • If you’re not at Yau Ma Tei Station yet, let me know your exact MTR station or train direction (e.g., are you on a train heading to Tsuen Wan?).
  • Fare: ~HKD 25-30 one-way (Octopus card easiest).
  • Ensure you have your passport and China visa/permit.

If you’re on the wrong train (e.g., heading toward Tsuen Wan), get off at the next stop, switch platforms to a southbound train toward Admiralty, and follow the steps above. Let me know if you need clarification or real-time help! Safe travels.
